channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-7332] [webui] HMaster webui should display the number of regions a table has.
item.description: Pre-0.96/trunk hbase displayed the number of regions per table in the table listing. Would be good to have this back.
item.summary: [webui] HMaster webui should display the number of regions a table has.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: This is what we found in the webui taken from checkout from trunk as of today which is 2.0.0-SNAPSHOT, r42fd7432225f6fbe4c273e7309d0bd4a8a2ffc18

The screenshot attached shows the list of online regions for each table. A table could have regions which are not online. May be beneficial to show the online regions, offline regions and transitional regions. The benefit is that the system administrator can check the progress of a table as it is being enabled or disabled.
Ranjana Rajendran Agree on showing offline and enabling. That'd be sweet. In a new issue? Seems like the reason for this issue has been satisfied?

Added index table->RegionState into RegionStates
Added method for getting HRegionInfo split by states from RegionStates
Expanded row in webgui to show more states:
Online Regions
Offline Regions
Failed Regions (failed to open and failed to close)
Split Regions (regions with split state)
Other Regions (all other states)

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12693160/HBASE-7332.patch
against master branch at commit 53815afc1023a624d6b6069f4111692951a78848.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12693160

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 3 new or modified tests.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

-1 checkstyle. The applied patch generated 2079 checkstyle errors (more than the master's current 2073 errors).

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

This message is automatically generated.

Seems checkstyle triggers on generated files from jamon.

stack, Ranjana Rajendran please, can you look at this?
patch is small enough, do we need RB here?

thank you.

Patch looks good. When does stuff get cleared from here?

79 private final Map<TableName, Map<String, RegionState>> regionStatesTableIndex =
80 new HashMap<TableName, Map<String, RegionState>>();

stack thanks for reviewing.
yes, it cleared in putRegionState() method (when region moved from one state to another) and in deleteRegion (when region is deleted, and it removed index for table if it becomes empty)
Very nice addition. Pushed to branch-1+ Tried to put in 0.98 but conflict. Thanks Andrey Stepachev
Here is what it adds to our table display. I messed with it enabling/disabling and the numbers updated in tune. We need more stuff like this (smile).

The patch for 0.98 seems not remove region from RegionStates#regionStatesTableIndex in RegionStates#deleteRegion(...) method?

The patch for 0.98 seems not remove region from RegionStates#regionStatesTableIndex in RegionStates#deleteRegion(...) method?

Yes it looks like I dropped a hunk. I'll file an issue to fix. Thanks for spotting this.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Adds counts for various regions states to the table listing on main page. See attached screenshot.
